The problem should be treated historically in relation to the history of welfare, care and the history and stories of Crisis Centres. The Crisis Centre celebrates its 40 years anniversary in 2018. Danish Welfare Museum will collect, register and conserve source material from Ringsted Crisis Centre and render visible the problem by communicate the stories of survivor women who used the Crisis Centre to escape from violence in relation to the history of welfare and care. 108'382.00 Denmark Oak Foundation Denmark 2018 12 months (13 Apr 2018-15 Apr 2019)
Danner Danner seeks funding for a mapping of Intimate Partner Sexual Violence IPSV in Denmark with four overall objectives in mind. Firstly, abolishing the taboo about this form of violence through a wide public information campaign. Secondly, with the aim of working with the legal status of victims of IPSV. Third, with the purpose of supporting work on one of Danner’s strategic goals for 2019, namely focusing on IPSV. And finally, fourthly, with the purpose of sharpening how the day-to-day practice in the shelter can be addressed to IPSV in the future. 89'809.00 Denmark Oak Foundation Denmark 2018 12 months (15 Nov 2018-15 Nov 2019)
